evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: On June 18, 2025, petitioner Osorto was waiting with others, including co-petitioners Pedro Vasquez Pedermo and Issac Antonio Villegas Molina, at a Pasadena, California bus stop to be picked up for a job. First Amended Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus and Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief (“FAP/Compl.”) ¶¶ 13, 124; see id. ¶¶ 111, 137. When petitioner saw federal agents approach, he tried to run but stopped when an agent pointed a taser at his head and said, “stop or I’ll use it.” Id. ¶ 125. Federal agents then handcuffed petitioner and put him in a vehicle. Id. ¶ 126.

extracted.value: Arrest at Pasadena bus stop on June 18, 2025: Federal agents approached petitioner, pointed a taser, and handcuffed him without a warrant.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Petitioner had a blood pressure reading of 190 and is experiencing dizziness, headaches, confusion, and burned, peeling skin. Id.

extracted.value: Serious medical conditions: Blood pressure 190, dizziness, headaches, confusion, and skin issues requiring immediate care.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: On July 2, 2025, petitioners Osorto, Vasquez Perdomo, and Villegas Molina, along with two other individuals and four organizational plaintiffs, filed the FAP/Compl. Docket no. 16. The FAP/Compl. maintains the claims in the initial habeas petition and adds class action claims concerning detention conditions and the denial of counsel.

extracted.value: Filing of First Amended Petition (FAP/Compl.) on July 2, 2025, adding class action claims about detention conditions and denial of counsel.
